title: Friedreich's Ataxia (FA)
description:
Friedreich's ataxia (FA) is a rare, inherited neurodegenerative disorder that primarily affects the nervous system and the heart. It is characterized by progressive damage to the spinal cord and peripheral nerves, resulting in muscle weakness and loss of coordination (ataxia) over time. FA is caused by mutations in the FXN gene, which leads to reduced production of a protein called frataxin. This protein is essential for the proper functioning of mitochondria, the energy-producing structures within cells.

Key features and symptoms of Friedreich's ataxia include:

1. **Ataxia**: Progressive loss of coordination and balance, often starting in childhood or adolescence.
2. **Muscle Weakness**: Gradual weakening of muscles, especially in the legs, leading to difficulty walking.
3. **Speech Problems**: Slurred speech (dysarthria) and difficulty with fine motor skills.
4. **Heart Issues**: Cardiomyopathy, a disease of the heart muscle, which can lead to heart failure.
5. **Skeletal Deformities**: Scoliosis (curvature of the spine) and foot deformities such as high arches.
6. **Diabetes**: Some individuals with FA may develop diabetes mellitus.
7. **Sensory Loss**: Loss of sensation, particularly in the lower limbs.

FA is an autosomal recessive disorder, meaning a person must inherit two copies of the defective gene (one from each parent) to develop the condition. There is currently no cure for Friedreich's ataxia, but various treatments and therapies aim to manage symptoms and improve quality of life. These include physical therapy, medications for heart and diabetes management, and surgical interventions for skeletal deformities. Research is ongoing to find more effective treatments and potentially a cure.

title: Friedreich's ataxia(flsh cards) | USMLE
description:
Friedreich's ataxia (FRDA or FA) is an autosomal recessive genetic disease that causes difficulty walking, a loss of sensation in the arms and legs and impaired speech that worsens over time. Symptoms generally start between 5 and 20 years of age. Many develop hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and will require a mobility aid such as a cane, walker or wheelchair in their teens. As the disease progresses, people lose their sight and hearing. Other complications include scoliosis and diabetes mellitus.

title: ATAXIA DE FRIEDREICH
cerebellar disorder. #successstory #cerebellar ataxia  #neuroplasticity   #shortdfeed
description:
Pre and post sessions result with a kid with cerebellar disorder .
Cerebellar disorders are conditions that affect the cerebellum, a part of the brain responsible for coordinating voluntary movements, balance, and posture. These disorders can result from various causes, including genetic factors, infections, tumors, strokes, and degenerative diseases. Symptoms may include problems with coordination, balance, muscle tone, and motor control. Treatment depends on the underlying cause and may include medication, physical therapy, and in some cases, surgery.

title: 1st HELLENIC FRIEDREICH’S ATAXIA INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE
description:
The Hellenic Association of FRIEDREICH’S ATAXIA is organizing the 1st International Hellenic Conference for the #rare_disease of FRIEDREICH’S #ATAXIA on May 6, 2022, at the Pasteur Hellenic Institute Amphitheatre, Athens. The Conference is organized as a #HYBRID event for everyone to watch online.
The purpose of the Conference is to demonstrate the scientific research and the clinical trials taking place all over the world and to increase the awareness of the disease, its rarity, and the urgent need for a cure.
The speakers of the Conference are doctors who specialize at FRIEDREICH’S ATAXIA and researchers from Greece and abroad, representatives from pharmaceutical companies, and representatives from Greek Institutions.

title: Talengiectasia ( ataxia talengiectasia )
Friedrich Ataxia ||  A Medical Deep Dive And Comprehensive guide.
description:
Discover the complexities and challenges of Friedrich's Ataxia, the most common form of hereditary ataxia identified by Nikolaus Friedrich in 1863. This video explores its onset during childhood, highlighting progressive symptoms like gait ataxia, coordination issues, and potential complications such as heart problems and diabetes mellitus. Dive deep into the genetic roots, where a mutation in the FXN gene reduces frataxin production, leading to cellular dysfunction. Learn about the importance of early diagnosis through comprehensive medical history, neurological exams, and genetic testing. Discover the multidisciplinary treatment approaches and the promising advancements in gene and drug therapies. Stay informed, share this video, and spread awareness! 

#FriedrichsAtaxia #GeneticDisorders #MedicalResearch #Neurology #HealthAwareness

OUTLINE: 

00:00:00 Introduction to Friedrich's Ataxia
00:00:49 Genetic Basis of Friedrich's Ataxia
00:01:44 Clinical Manifestations of Friedrich's Ataxia
00:02:31 Diagnosis of Friedrich's Ataxia
00:03:26 Treatment and Management of Friedrich's Ataxia
00:04:14 The Future of Friedrich's Ataxia Treatment and Research

title: U.S. FDA approves Reata's rare genetic disorder drug|#shorts
description:
#shorts

(Reuters) -The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday approved Reata Pharmaceuticals Inc's drug for the treatment of a rare genetic disorder that causes progressive damage to the nervous system, sending shares up nearly 160% after the bell.  The drug, Skyclarys, is Reata's first product to gain approval, and Jefferies analyst Maury Raycroft projected that U.S. sales of the drug could reach $400 million by 2030.  Reata estimates the disorder, called Friedreich's ataxia, affects about 5,000 patients in the United States.

I was born with a rare disability known as Friedrich Ataxia or just FA for short. It only affects me physically and it is degenerative. Business use only scott_lynch_pop@yahoo.com

I was diagnosed with Friedreich's ataxia in 1994 at the age of 12. 

Friedreich's ataxia is an inherited disorder that affects some of the body's nerves. It is caused by a gene defect that is inherited from both parents. Symptoms generally start between 5 and 20 years of age and can include trouble walking, fatigue, changes in sensation, and slowed speech.

title: Unveiling SKYCLARYS: A New Hope for Friedreich's Ataxia
description:
In this eye-opening video, we uncover the revolutionary treatment for Friedreich's Ataxia - SKYCLARYS. Join us as we dive deep into the science behind this groundbreaking drug, exploring its numerous benefits and potential side effects. title: Ataxia Freidreich - Homoeopathic treatment @ Sherriff's Homoeopathy (3)
description:
Freidreich Ataxia - A rare genetic , disabling, neurogenerative , progressively  disabling disease leading to impaired and incoordinated muscle movement of arms and legs ending in difficult walk  and working with hands.
Slurred speech, deformities and cardiomyopathy can develop in later stage. 
This girl of about 10 years was brought being carried by her father. This was her routine , as she was being helped by parents in daily jobs.
Homoeopathic treatment @ Sherriff's Homoeopathy now has  led her to develop the changes in her ability to 
1. walk alone.
2. rise up in the washroom alone.
3. go up and down about 15 stairs on her own.
4. can eat by her self with both hand support.
5. sensations on hand skin has developed, which were absent before the Homoeopathic treatment.
6. started going to school in the  last week's.
Progressive improvement is being observed on weekly basis and the treatment is continued @ Sherriff's Homoeopathy.
channel_name: Dr Ijaz Naseem - Sherriff's Homoeopathy MBBS DHMS

description:
आज बेहद दुर्लभ मानी जाने वाली बीमारी 'फ्रीडरिक्स अटैक्सिया' की बात करते हैं. इस जेनेटिक बीमारी की वजह से 25 साल से कम उम्र के लोगों के नर्वस सिस्टम में परेशानी आती है. जिंदगी भर के लिए बेड रिडन तक कर देने वाले FRDA के असर को कम करने के लिए दवा तो खोज ली गई है. लेकिन पेटेंट होने की वजह से वो आसानी से भारत में उपलब्ध नहीं है. बाहर से मंगवाने और एक महीने की खुराक के लिए इस पर लाखों रुपये खर्च करने पड़ते हैं. हालांकि अब दिल्ली एम्स ने इस दवा को भारत में सुलभ बनाने के लिए प्रयास तेज कर दिए हैं.

title: Son mis 3 únicos hijos y los 3 la tienen #enfermedadrara #ataxia #empatia #proposito
description:
🟡En este episodio tenemos a una persona muy especial, Marian. Una madre que tras tener a sus hijos, descubrió que todo ellos tenían una enfermedad rara, hereditaria, sin cura ni tratamiento; la ataxia de Friedreich. A partir de ahí, empezó su lucha y concienciación por la felicidad de sus hijos a través de redes (viviendo con ataxia) y muchos otros medios. En este episodio hablamos de la ataxia de Friedreich, enfermedades raras, investigación, incertidumbre, duelo por enfermedad, maternidad, inteligencia emocional, psicología, el momento presente, concienciación, empatía, educación y muchas cosas más...

🟡Suscríbete para no perderte ningún episodio del PODCAST

title: CUAM #22: Javier Díaz Nido. La Ataxia de Friedreich.
description:
Conociendo la UAM es el canal que te acerca las capacidades científico, técnicas, artísticas y culturales de los grupos de investigación de la Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, con el objetivo de aproximar las relaciones universidad - sociedad, aumentando el impacto social, así como para fomentar las relaciones institucionales y de innovación y formación continua entre el tejido económico, social y la universidad.

En esta ocasión, hablamos con Javier Díaz Nido, Catedrático del Departamento de Biología Molecular de la Facultad de Ciencias UAM, sobre la Ataxia de Friedreich.

title: 5 essential facts about Friedreich's Ataxia
description: 18 year young girl with seven year history of progressive weakness in distal muscles of hand and feet.Clumsy ness of hands with difficulty in holding glass of water and slipping of chapals . intellect is normal.power in hands is 3/5.gaint is on toes, with intensity to fall.high arched bilateral feet with pes cavas appreciated.No opthalmoparesis, dysarthria , extra pyramidal signs.There is no definite cure but supportive and symptomatic conservative management.

Hoy hablamos sobre la Ataxia de Friedreich, con una prevalencia estimada de 1 cada 20000 o 50000 personas.
Me gustaría hacer un inciso explicando que la omaveloxolona todavía se encuentra en ensayos clínicos, tendría que haber dicho que "tiene muchas papeletas para" convertirse en un posible tratamiento paliativo de la enfermedad.
El estudio de enfermedades minoritarias es importantísimo, tanto como para los que sufren una de estas enfermedades como para la población general. Además, hay que defender a capa y espada la investigación pública para que muchos grupos de investigación que se dedican a esto puedan seguir adelante.

title: Handicap accessible car Friedreich’s ataxia style
Friedreich's Ataxia (FA) What is this rare disease? A new chapter for us!
description:
Friedreich's ataxia (FA) is a rare, inherited disease that causes progressive damage to the nervous system: 

Symptoms usually begin between the ages of 5 and 15, but can appear later in life: 
Impaired muscle coordination (ataxia) 
Difficulty walking 
Poor balance 
Loss of sensation in the arms and legs 
Slowed speech 
Hearing loss 
Vision loss 
Scoliosis (curvature of the spine) 
Heart disease, such as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy 
Diabetes.

Prognosis.. Most patients die within ten to 20 years after being diagnosed. Some die much sooner, as each individuals body progresses at different levels. There is NO known cure and the life of a person with this disease will be incredibly challenging!

title: Ataxia de Friedriech

title: Nashville Comedian Fiona Cauley On Advocating For Yourself And Living With Friedreich's Ataxia
description:
"I'm Fine, It's Fine" is a must-listen podcast for anyone interested in mental health, comedy, and trauma therapy. In this episode, you'll be introduced to a comedian, Fiona Cauley, who lives with Friedreich's Ataxia, a rare disease that affects the nervous system. Fiona opens up about the challenges she faces and how she uses humor to cope.

The podcast is more than just entertainment, it's an education. You'll learn about the disease and the impact it has on the life of Fiona, but you'll also learn about mental health, trauma therapy, and the power of laughter. The episode is a window into the life of someone who has to deal with a debilitating disease every day, but who still finds the strength to make others laugh.

By listening to "I'm Fine, It's Fine", you'll not only be entertained but also inspired. You'll learn about the human spirit, resilience, and the importance of maintaining a positive outlook on life, even when faced with adversity. Fiona's story will touch your heart and make you see the world in a different light.

If you're looking for a podcast that's both entertaining and educational, "I'm Fine, It's Fine" is it. The combination of mental health, comedy, and trauma therapy makes it a unique and valuable listen. And, with each episode, you'll come away with a greater understanding of what it takes to live alongside struggles and the importance of laughter in our lives.

So, what are you waiting for? Press play and join the conversation about mental health, comedy, and trauma therapy. And, don't forget to share this episode with someone who could use a little inspiration today. Together, let's spread the word about the power of laughter and the importance of taking care of our mental health.

#freidreichsataxia #mentalhealthpodcast #comedypodcast #laughterismedicine #laughterisgoodforthesoul

title: I have a form of muscular dystrophy called Friedriech’s Ataxia #GypsyRose#GypsyRoseRelease
Post 53 | Overcoming Communication Barriers with Large Language Models
description:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing communication for individuals with conditions like Friedreich's Ataxia. The key lies in their training on extensive linguistic datasets. These datasets provide the LLM with a rich understanding of syntax, morphology, and semantics. The benefits extend beyond simple translation. LLMs reduce the cognitive load associated with communication, allowing individuals to focus on the content of their message rather than the mechanics of speech. 
They also offer increased accessibility, providing a consistent and reliable communication tool that can be used in a variety of settings. Furthermore, these models can be integrated with various devices, offering flexible and adaptable solutions. We explore how the sophisticated linguistic processing within these models is enabling more effective and cohesive communication for Andrew Marshall and others, and how these benefits are transforming lives.
Key Benefits to Emphasize:
Increased Independence: LLMs empower individuals to communicate without constant reliance on others.
Reduced Frustration: Clearer communication minimizes misunderstandings and frustration.
Enhanced Social Inclusion: Improved communication facilitates meaningful social interactions.
Faster Communication: LLMs can process and generate responses quickly, improving communication efficiency.
Accuracy: LLMs can accurately interpret fragmented or altered speech.
Personalization: Models can be tailored to individual speech patterns.
Reduced Cognitive Load: LLMs handle the linguistic processing, allowing users to focus on their message.
Increased Accessibility: LLMs provide a reliable communication tool in various settings.
Adaptability: LLMs can be integrated with various devices and platforms.
Improved Quality of Life: Overall, LLMs contribute to a better quality of life by facilitating effective communication.

title: Mis 3 únicos hijos tienen una enfermedad neurodegenerativa - Marian | Un Propósito #53
description:
🟡Suscríbete para no perderte ningún episodio del PODCAST

En este episodio tenemos a una persona muy especial, Marian. Una madre que tras tener a sus hijos, descubrió que todo ellos tenían una enfermedad rara, hereditaria, sin cura ni tratamiento; la ataxia de Friedreich. A partir de ahí, empezó su lucha y concienciación por la felicidad de sus hijos a través de redes (viviendo con ataxia) y muchos otros medios. En este episodio hablamos de la ataxia de Friedreich, enfermedades raras, investigación, incertidumbre, duelo por enfermedad, maternidad, inteligencia emocional, psicología, el momento presente, concienciación, empatía, educación y muchas cosas más...

👉🏽 Redes de Marian (viviendo con ataxia):
https://www.instagram.com/viviendo_con_ataxia?igsh=cmcxODhpMzBjcXlm

Gracias por todo, de corazón.❤️
